thread.title: Cubs legends wear new jerseys in advance of the Wild Card game
thread.title_full: Cubs legends wear new jerseys in advance of the Wild Card game | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Cubs legends wear new jerseys in advance of the Wild Card game
text:
The statues outside of Wrigley Field received a wardrobe change Monday before the Cubs head to Pittsburgh for the Wild Card game.
The three statues of Cubs greats Ernie Banks, Ron Santo and Billy Williams were all draped in new jerseys Monday morning.
A photo posted by Paul Sullivan (@pwsullivan) on Oct 5, 2015 at 9:05am PDT
A photo posted by Paul Sullivan (@pwsullivan) on Oct 5, 2015 at 9:09am PDT
Decorating the many statues throughout Chicago with sports apparel is far from a new trend. In fact, the Cubs legends aren’t even the first Chicago statues to put on a Cubs jersey in the last week.
The brachiosaurus skeleton replica outside the Field Museum was give a custom jersey specially made to fit the 75-foot frame.
Usually, this dinosaur at the Field Museum has a #Blackhawks jersey. Now, it's wearing a #Cubs jersey! #FlyTheW pic.twitter.com/rcdXH8LVrs
— Chicago Sports (@MyChicagoSports) October 3, 2015
Cubs fans throughout the city hope these statues and more will keep their jerseys on not only through Wednesday but the rest of October as well.
